question: 1. What is the minimum number of cylindrical specimens needed for the test as per IS:516?
2. What should be the ratio of gauge length of the strain measuring apparatus (extensometers or strain gauges) to the diameter of test specimens?
3. How centering of the specimen is checked during the experiment?

answers.a: By checking if the individual strains are within a range of ±20 percent of their mean value at σb, at the first preloading cycle
answers.b: By checking if the individual strains are within a range of ±20 percent of their mean value at σa, at the first preloading cycle
answers.c: By checking if the individual strains are within a range of ±20 percent of their mean value at σa, at the last loading cycle
answers.d: Not necessary to check centering of the specimen.

question: 4. On a concrete specimen of cylindrical compressive strength 27 MPa, longitudinal strains at basic and upper loading stress are 0.0001 and 0.0003. static modulus of elasticity will be
